Description: Fake mould-made pottery lamp of debased Hellenistic type, with a deep rounded body. The rounded shoulders are decorated in relief with bands of studs and voluted tendrils. Around the filling-hole is a band of short rays. The top of the nozzle is decorated with a bearded mask. At the rear is an applied handle (broken). The underside is pared to shape. The clay is fired black underneath and on the left side.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3465)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
